result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC at the rate of 25% of funds.  Any remaining balance to be paid immediately or entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.  IN Wisconsin State Prison system.
Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA speciment for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Matthew Gasper Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term of 9 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 0 days credit, Straight Time, Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court costs, fines, surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections at the rate of 25% of funds. Any remaining balance to be paid immediately or entry of civil judgment. 

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Daugherty).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-18-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for Patricia I. Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. No offer made by State. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in court with Patricia Fritz who appears under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Thomas Matthew Gasper in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
